title: PM outperforms past govts on diplomatic front: Farrukh
content:
ISLAMABAD, Mar 23 (APP):Minister of State for Information and Broadcasting Farrukh Habib Wednesday said Prime Minister Imran Khan had made matchless diplomatic achievements in the last three and half years.
He, in a series of tweets, said PM Imran Khan, in comparison to all the past governments, had made numerous diplomatic achievements during the last three and half years.
Farrukh said it was the first time in the history that the country got a leader who went beyond the politics of “chits” and had courage to speak [with other countries’ leaders] by looking into eyes. The entire world respected the prime minister, he added.
Highlighting the prime minister’s achievements at foreign front, he said two meetings of the Organization of Islamic Cooperation (OIC) were held in the country in the last three months. His efforts also led to the adoption of a resolution by the United Nations to designate March 15 as an “International Day to Combat Islamophobia”, he added.
The minister said it was the prime minister who drew attention of the whole world towards the humanitarian situation in Afghanistan. He also revived the Kashmir issue at international level by becoming a “brave advocate” of the people of Kashmir. “Only Prime Minister Imran Khan can do all of this,” the minister remarked.
